III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/11/2023 staff were searching rooms and a female staff
member kept using the "wand thing" poking the youth in the
"coochie". This was reported to a supervisor.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was unable to be interviewed as Youth A has been
AWOLP from the facility since 9/12/2023 and continues to be
AWOLP.
Youth B was interviewed face-to face at school on 9/14/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported she
was returning with Staff 3 from a home pass when Staff 3 received
a telephone call from the facility asking their estimated time of
arrival at the facility. Youth B heard the phone conversation where
Staff 3 was informed she was needed to assist with a metal
detector wand search on Youth A due to concerns Youth A “put a
vape in her kitty”. Staff 3 and Youth B arrived at the facility and
went to the medication room so Youth B could be searched.
Youth A was also in the medication room to be searched. Youth A
was standing with her legs closed while Staff 4 used the metal
detector wand. Youth B reported Staff 4 used the metal detector
wand and used the wand to move up Youth A’s thigh area towards
Youth A’s vaginal area as there was concern Youth A had the
vape in her private area. Youth A asked Staff 4 why she was
using the metal detector wand “there” referring to her vaginal area.
Staff 4 explained to Youth A it is was due to concern of her having
a vape hidden in that area. Youth B did not have any concerns
with what she witnessed. Staff 3 was conducting the metal
detector wand check and did not touch Youth A in any
inappropriate manner. Youth B reported Staff 4 told Youth B prior
to this incident not to use a vape if it was circulating through the
house due to concern with some youth at the house having
sexually transmitted diseases and concerns that youth were hiding
vapes in their vaginal areas. Youth B reported she was aware
that some of the youth have sexually transmitted diseases as one
of the youth disclosed this information to her as well as staff
needing to sanitize the bathroom after certain youth use the
bathroom. Youth B reported the vape was found while Youth A
was being searched as Youth A had put the vape in the couch in
the living room prior to coming into the medication room to be
2

searched and a youth reported this to the staff supervising in the
living room. Youth B reported concerns of staff favoritism which is
being addressed in special investigation 2023C0000732SI.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 was
working the night shift on 9/11/2023 into the morning of 9/12/2023
when Youth A was returned to the facility from being Absent
Without Legal Permission (AWOLP) by law enforcement around
12:40am. Staff 1 asked to do a pat search on Youth A as Youth A
had been AWOLP and wanted to ensure Youth A did not return to
the facility with contraband. Youth A refused to have a pat search
completed. Law enforcement was called back to the facility as
Youth A continuously was refusing to be searched and was not
following directions from Staff 1. Law enforcement returned and
told Youth A to allow Staff 1 to conduct the pat search. Staff 1
began to pat search Youth A by using the back of her hands to pat
down Youth A’s arms, top of Youth A’s shoulders, and mid back.
Youth A moved away from Staff 1 and told Staff 1 not to touch her.
Law enforcement explained to Youth A what a pat search was and
how Staff 1 was doing the pat search. Youth A reported a staff
used the “wand and touched her coochie with it last week.” Youth
A refused to tell which staff she was referring to. Staff 1 reported
law enforcement was present the entire time when she was
conducting the pat search with Youth A. Staff 1 never used the
metal detector wand which is referred to as the wand. Youth A
continued to refuse to allow Staff 1 to complete the pat search.
Staff 1 attempted to continue the pat search with patting the
outside of Youth A’s legs and Youth A moved away again. Staff 1
stopped the pat search. Staff 1 reported it is facility practice to do
pat searches on youth when youth return to the facility from
school, outings, or when youth return from AWOLP. Staff 1 was
getting ready to leave the facility in the morning when Youth A
requested to call her caseworker at which time Youth A was heard
by Staff 3 reporting allegation that Staff 4 “felt her up with a wand”.
Staff 1 reported staff are to use the metal detector wand when
conducting searches however Staff 1 did not use the metal
detector wand when she searched Youth A due to not knowing
where it was kept as Staff 1 works night shift and does not
typically need to use it. Staff 1 has never observed a staff use the
metal detector wand. Staff 1 reported Youth A did have a vape
that she was passing back and forth with another youth last week
that was found and confiscated. Staff 1 reported she did not
explain to Youth A what she was doing while conducting the pat
search.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 was
working the night shift on 9/11/2023 into the morning of 9/12/2023
when Staff 1 conducted a pat search on Youth A after Youth A
was returned by law enforcement from being AWOLP however
Staff 2 was not present when the pat search occurred. Staff 2
reported youth are searched when they come into the facility from
school, outings, or being AWOLP. Staff 2 explained the search
process as youth placing their arms out and spreading their legs
and staff pat the youth with the back of their hands. During the
pat search a second staff is present to observe. The metal
detector wand is used around the private areas including the
breast, vagina, and buttocks areas where staff do not pat. Staff 2
reported she has never had concerns about staff conducting pat
searches or metal detector wand searches inappropriately.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 was
transporting a youth on 9/10/2023 and was contacted by the
facility to determine her return time as there were concerns with
Youth A having contraband and the facility wanted to conduct a
search of Youth A but needed another female staff to be present.
Staff 3 reported there were concerns Youth A was passing a vape
back and forth with another youth and Youth A currently had the
vape on her. Staff 3 returned to the facility and observed while
Staff 4 used the metal detector wand to search Youth A in the
medication room. Staff 4 asked Youth A to spread her legs and
Youth A would not move her legs more than shoulder width apart.
Staff 4 placed the metal detector wand between Youth A’s legs at
her knees. Staff 3 reported Staff 4 did not move the metal
detector wand any higher than Youth A’s knees. Youth A was
facing Staff 3 and Staff 4 was standing behind Youth A. At this
time a staff in the living room located the vape that Youth A had
placed in the couch prior to going into the medication room to be
searched. The search was stopped at this time. Staff 3 reported
she has never had concerns with searches being done
inappropriately. Staff 3 reported she was present on 9/12/2023
when Youth A called her caseworker. Staff 3 heard Youth A tell
her caseworker Staff 4 “was trying to wand her and touched her
private parts with the wand”. Staff 3 reported youth are searched
using a pat search when they return from off grounds and the
metal detector wand is used quickly during these searches as well
as the metal detector wand is used when there are concerns of a
youth having contraband on them.
4

Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/28/2023. Staff 4 reported there was concern of Youth A and
another youth passing a vape around in the house. Youth A was
believed to have a vape on her as Youth A was acting fidgety and
had requested to go to her bedroom after immediately using the
bathroom after another youth. Staff 4 took Youth A to her
bedroom where Staff 4 was closely monitoring what Youth A was
doing. Youth A was fidgeting around in her bedroom as Staff 4
closely monitored her. Youth A reported she needed a new bra
and was holding her breast area. Staff 4 believed Youth A was
concealing a vape in her bra. Staff 4 told the supervisor on shift of
her concern, and it was determined after Staff 3 returned from her
transport that Staff 3 and Staff 4 would conduct a search on Youth
A. Staff 4 called Staff 3 to obtain an approximant return time and
informed Staff 3 she had concerns that Youth A had a vape by her
“titties”. When Staff 3 returned with Youth B, Staff 3, Staff 4,
Youth A, and Youth B went into the medication room to do a
search as Youth B needed to be searched from returning from a
home pass. Staff 4 conducted a pat down search on Youth A and
then used the metal detector. Staff 4 reported she focused on
Youth A’s chest area with the metal detector due to concerns of
her having the vape in her bra. Staff 4 used the wand to run over
Youth A’s arms and between Youth A’s legs as she was trained.
Staff 4 denied touching Youth A’s vagina with the metal detector.
Staff 4 reported she completed the search at which time the
supervisor on shift informed her the vape had been located in the
couch. A youth witnessed Youth A place the vape in the couch
prior to going back to be searched and the youth informed the
supervisor on shift. Staff 4 reported she never had any concerns
of the vape being in Youth A’s underwear and had believed the
vape to be in Youth A’s bra. Staff 4 reported at no time did she
“poke” Youth A in the vaginal area. Staff 4 reported there have
been youth in the facility with sexually transmitted disease and
there have been safety precautions put into place for after the
youth with sexually transmitted diseases use the bathroom such
as spraying the toilet area with Lysol. Staff 4 reported she has
never discussed any of the youth’s sexually transmitted disease
diagnosis with any other youth at the facility. Staff 4 reported
many of the youth are aware of youth who have sexually
transmitted diseases at the facility due to the youth disclosing the
information to one another. Staff 4 reported staff are not allowed
to discuss youth’s diagnosis with other youth. Staff 4 denied
every speaking to any youth about not using a vape due to
concerns that the vape has been hidden in the vaginal area or
concerns of sexually transmitted diseases being passed.
5

Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/14/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor
reported youth are searched every time youth return from school
and outings. Staff are trained to do pat searches on youth where
the staff use the back of their hand and pat down the youth’s
arms, back, legs. Supervisor reported the metal detector wand is
used when there is suspicion of a youth having an item to self-
harm with or contraband. If a youth refuses to be searched, staff
then just watch the youth closely. There had been rumors in the
house that youth had a vape however it was not specific to which
youth. Staff were aware of this concern and were watching
closely to find out who had the vape. Youth A was found to be
passing the vape back and forth with another youth and it was
confiscated on 9/10/2023.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 9/13/2023.
Complainant reported Youth A has previously snuck vapes into
her previous placement. Complainant reported Youth A disclosed
the information during a Family Team Meeting and then asked
Complainant when she would get Youth A moved from the facility.
MDHHS worker does not have any findings in this
investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/10/2023 in the medication room and 9/12/2023
in the living room/entry way was reviewed on 9/14/2023.
9/10/2023: Youth A, Youth B, Staff 3, and Staff 4 are in the
medication room. Staff 3 moves over to the corner of the room
near the open closet door and is not able to be seen on video.
Due to the closet door being open, there is blockage on the video.
Youth B is standing near the staff desk, Staff 4 is standing behind
Youth A, and Youth A is facing the closet door where Staff 3 is
located. Staff 4 uses the metal detector wand and runs it down
Youth A’s back and buttock area. Staff 4 moves down to use the
metal detector wand in between Youth A’s legs however this
entire view cannot be seen on the video due to the closet door
blocking from the floor to Youth A’s upper thigh area. The metal
detector wand can be seen through Youth A’s legs near her
vaginal area as Staff 4 moves the metal detector wand through
Youth A’s legs. No concerns on the video show Staff 4 poking or
placing the metal detector wand in Youth A’s vaginal area
inappropriately.
6

9/12/2023: Staff 1 is in the living room entry way with Youth A and
law enforcement. Staff 1 is viewed attempting to do a pat down
search on Youth A. Youth A moves away. Staff 1 never uses the
metal detector wand during this search of Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center Policies and
Procedures Contraband and Search Practices: Search
practices shall be initiated to assist in prevention, detection
and removal of all items considered contraband or
unauthorized within the program. All searches shall be
conducted in a manner, which avoids the use of
unnecessary force, ensures treatment with dignity and
respect, and minimizes stress and embarrassment. Pat
down searches are conducted through the youth’s clothing
by a staff member of the same gender as the youth. Search
does not require youth to remove clothing, may include the
use of a wand. Searches may be conducted at any time a
youth may have had the opportunity to hide weapons or
contraband, transportation community outings and
circumstances requiring reasonable suspicion.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
related to youth searches and Staff 4 was trained on
conducting searches on 12/3/2022.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per viewing the video and
interviews, the staff did not poke the youth in the vaginal area with
the metal detector while conducting the search. The staff was
viewed to be completing the metal detector search as trained by
the facility as she was using the metal detector on the youth’s
arms, chest area, and went in between the youth’s legs.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings, the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended no change to the license status of
this child caring institution.
